location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: printed on paper.Dimensions: 680 x 1,010 mm.Foliation: the plan has been foliated with the number 105 written in pencil enclosed in a circle in the top right corner of the recto side of the folio.

mods.abstract: Plan of the proposed coal depot at Koweit [Kuwait].The plan is an accompaniment to letter no. 2461 from Lieutenant-Colonel Percy Zachariah Cox, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, to the Secretary to the Government of India in the Foreign Department, Simla, dated 11 September 1910 (a copy of the letter appears on folio 100). A note in crayon on the verso of the map states that it was sent with the Secretary's letter of 13 October 1910.The plan shows coal godowns, proposed pier, and 'Shaik's [Shaikh's] Coal Shed'.Additionally, there is a 'Section on Y.Z.' (scale: vertical 10 feet = 1 inch; horizontal 60 feet = 1 inch) inscribed 'Copied from plan of Shweikh made by Officers of H.M.S. Lapwing (July 1909)'.
